In a large-scale crisis, the message communicated to parents requires inter-agency coordination. Due to the complexity of the event, multiple agencies will be involved in crafting the message.

page.normal_text:
Why did we target parents/guardians?
Why did we target parents/guardians?

Application process for the Emergency Response and Crisis Management grant revealed a gap and inconsistencies in the notification process for parents/guardians during a large-scale school emergency.
Application process for the Emergency
Response and Crisis Management grant

during a large-scale school emergency.

In other words, we did not have a division-wide plan!
In other words, we did not have a division-wide plan!

What is our message for parents?
What is our message for parents?

page.title:
Parent School Emergency Guide
Parent School Emergency Guide

picture.name: Image85
picture.caption: As a parent how can you be prepared for a school emergency?

page.title:
Parent School Emergency Guide
Parent School Emergency Guide
page.normal_text:
Internal Lockdown: All school interior doors are locked and students are confined to their classrooms and no entry or exit of the school is allowed. This takes place if there is a threat or possible threat inside the school.
Internal Lockdown: All school interior doors are locked and students are I n t e r n a l

i n t e r i o r

a r e
confined to their classrooms and no entry or exit of the school is allowed. This
takes place if there is a threat or possible threat inside the school.

External lockdown: All school exterior doors are locked. This takes place if the threat is outside of the school.
External lockdown: All school exterior doors are locked. This takes place if the E x t e r n a l

threat is outside of the school.

Shelter-in-Place: Selecting small, interior rooms in the school, with no or few windows, and taking refuge there until it is safe to release students.
Shelter-in-Place: Selecting small, interior rooms in the school, with no or few S h e l t e r - i n - P l a c e : S e l e c t i n g

Reunification of parents/students: Each school has a procedure for helping parents locate their child. Parents will be directed to a specific location where they will be required to show proper identification.

page.title:
Communication After an Emergency
Communication After an Emergency
page.normal_text:
Critical information must be delivered to parents.
Critical information must be delivered to parents.
page.enlisting:
• Determine how best to communicate: letter, Web site, • Issue facts regarding incident, to include: • Correct any inaccurate information released by the media • Share actions taken by school administration • Provide additional safety precautions in place • Stress the importance of student safety • Ensure that staff members receive the same accurate information that will be provided to parents. • Communicate to parents signs of post-traumatic stress, • Determine how best to communicate: letter, Web site, • Issue facts regarding incident, to include: • Correct any inaccurate information released by the media • Share actions taken by school administration • Provide additional safety precautions in place • Stress the importance of student safety • Determine how best to communicate: letter, Web site,

page.title:
Lessons Learned • As incident unfolds, commander (Police Sergeant-Police Lieutenant-SWAT Lieutenant) can change making it difficult to get a timely message to parents.
Lessons Learned
• As incident unfolds, commander (Police Sergeant-Police • A s

u n f o l d s ,

difficult to get a timely message to parents.

page.enlisting:
